data.text:
@dianecope1958 She looks like a most wonderful person, Diane! 
Medicine has made progress since your mother's time. My mother just survived what her mother would have died of. Here in Germany, the breast cancer survival rate is 90%, which lets me hope Faye will be fine at the end of summer!

@michelleburl Hopefully Faye won't need chemo, she has posted on Face book, asking people to re post. She told me, if she can just get 10 women to check their boobs it will be worth it. I hope your family member is doing ok, both physically and mentally xxx Thanks Michelle xxx https://t.co/aU6OJXqFB4

@tweetsbi Thanks, I think what makes this so poignant for us is my mum got breast cancer when she was just a few years older than Faye, and she died age 51, when I was 31 and Faye was 10. Faye says she has to get better soon, she is doing a wing walk in May!!! That's my girl! xxx https://t.co/rTL9XZlPMx

@dianecope1958 Oh no Diane, I am so sorry for her and for you! I hope your daughter fares as well as my mum, who has it pretty much behind her by now. She certainly has a lot of good spirit, that much is clear! Best of luck to her! I hope this carries her far!
DM me anytime if you feel like it!
@dianecope1958 It’s horrible isn’t it, I have a family member with breast cancer going through chemo, she’s doing well. Fingers crossed x
@michelleburl It's small Michelle. She is having it removed on 23rd and will have radiotherapy and HRT, hopefully no chemo. Was such a bloody shock, I have never cried so much in my life xxx
@mat_rosey Hi Mat, She jumps out of planes quite a lot and has to get better asap because she is doing a wing walk in June! xxx
@dianecope1958 Sorry to hear that Diane but I certainly admire her spirit!
@dianecope1958 Hope your daughter makes a full recovery 🙏
